description: Upgrade of telecommunications equipment to include erection of equipment cabin, pole antennae and transmission dishes at roof level of Burghley Tower
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of  five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Any machinery audible outside the premises must be designed to an acoustic standard not exceeding Noise Rating NR35 measured or calculated at the nearest horizontal or vertical boundary of the nearest affected dwelling, whichever is the closer.   REASON:  To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers. | A safe distance shall be provided between the source and receivers and control of the beam of radio frequency intensity, so that radiation exposure levels will not present a risk to members of the public and persons within the nearest buildings.  Appropriate measures shall be taken to protect persons within the buildings and members of the public.  REASON:  To safeguard the health and safety of nearby residents and the general public.
